Home Die2nite Roadhouse of the Reckless [Contest] Season 4 Scavenger Hunt!
On october 16, 2011
NyxOwl
I propose a scavenger hunt for Season 4. There are usually down times between serious town jumps so it might be fun to pursue some other interests.

What you need to find/achieve:



1. Be in at least 1 town with BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the town name.

2. Kill at least 100 zombies

3. Find 1 Roleplay Item

4. Build at least 1 Wonder and receive the distinction

5. 1 Masochism Distinction

6. 5 Alcohol Distinctions

7. 3 Daredevil Camper Distinctions

8. Play all 4 professions (residents can still participate but they will have it extra tough begging for those BIA’s).

9. Post 100 messages

10. Play with 5 specific players. ***(See more on this below).


How it will work:

I will take a screenshot of all of the participant’s Soul on the 1st Day of Season 4. You must sign up in this thread to confirm you want to join and guarantee a screenshot of your soul. (Residents will need a hero to post on their behalf). I will have a contest thread at die2nite.net to show the Souls and keep a running tab of the contest and to have fun commenting and hopefully seeing residents comment as well.

Contest will last all of Season 4. Another screenshot of your Soul will be taken on the last day of Season 4 to tally the results and determine a winner. In the event of any ties than a tie breaker contest will be announced. The winner will receive 30 free hero days AND 30 free hero days for ANY player they choose.

***Regarding playing with 5 Specific Players. I will need 20 volunteers who will be active in Season 4 to offer their name as a person to play with.

For Example:

1. NyxOwl
2. Workshop
3. Tamle
4. Dkarba
5. Deblyn
6. Fortis

The participants in the contest will roll a D20 dice Five times to determine which 5 players they will need to try to get into a town with at some point during Season 4. If the same number/person comes up in their roll than they will need to re-roll to get a different name. (You do not need to be in the same town with all 5 players at one time you just need to have played in a town with them during Season 4).

I will use a D6 dice with the above example names to see who I would have to end up in a town with in Season 4 at some point.

 2 (D6)  1 (D6)  6 (D6) (see the results in the 2nd post)

***These names are just examples, I’m familiar with all of your posts so I grabbed your names as examples. I hope you don’t mind ***

What I need from you:

19 Volunteers who will be active throughout Season 4 who will lend their name as a person to play with. (Of course I will throw my name in there!)

Participants in this contest! (If interested start posting that you want to join)

Any feedback or suggestions! I came up with this on a whim so I might be missing important details.

Going out on a limb, English isn't your first language?

So maybe "crap town" was too strong a negativity, but what I mean is, after the MMJ town I'm now in a local town that, if the town isn't devastated after the 5 day grace period I'd be amazed. In as a scout, took a walk around the park in the NW, found two of the Architect's Chests and did a little digging. Not much to bring home, but still had to use Heroic Return. BP's were Faucet and Defensive Focus.

Day 2 I took a walk around the SW, no more BP's, but did wander through a previously undiscovered building. Also got tho throw a rat at a zed and a cat at 2 more, so there's 3 kills right there. There was also talk on the boards about having the ingredients to build the explosive water bombs, so throw up a post stating I'd like to build it to clear the OPS for digging (OPS buried under 15 ticks of debris).

About 2 hours before attack I throw the ingredients in my chest (not combined) and throw up a separate post again asking for permission to build the explosive water bomb. Couple people say it's fine, so about a half hour after the attack, I got 9 kills on the OPS and can start digging, find a beer fridge and there go the final three, so now I'm up to 15 kills and it's all helping the town. Also got a successful camp in, lot of digging, going to camp again tonight (day 4). With luck, I'll be bringing home an uncommon blueprint on day 5, and with more luck I'll be able to make it to the garden shed and explore it on the way.

Surviving tonight means two distant discoveries (possibly 3), 15 zed kills plus what I get tomorrow, two Daredevil campers, about 10 ticks of excavation, 2 butchers, and 4 heroic actions (will need seeker tomorrow for a food or water), and that's all from barely trying and in no way hurting the town.

Town happens to be called "bad pits of sand" so there's #1. I'm 15/100 kills in for #2. currently 1/3 for camping for #7, and with luck will be 2/3 in the morning. Scout this town, so that's 1/4 for #8. Don't know how many messages I made so far, but wouldn't be surprised if I made the 100 without spamming by the end of my run in this town for #9. So I'm getting a third of the list done without even trying and without screwing up the town, so it's certainly possible to get almost everything without being a total a-hole.

Now, there is a guy who managed to get himself shunned, he has a house on day 4, trying to tell us it isn't selfish, and I have to agree, it isn't selfish, it's idiotic. I tried educating him in a nice way, why spending those points on his home this early wasn't good for the town, when he was still only at the shack level, but apparently he didn't care. Tried telling him nicely if he makes it to distant towns he'll be shunned quickly and without mercy (tried telling him in a nicer way than that, this is just the summary), but apparently he wants to learn the hard way.

Another thing I've been hearing is they're voting pump for the second day in a row now, and we're only on day 4. This town is doomed and it's form the n00bs and newbies.

So, honestly, you don't need to be selfish and sabotage a town to get ahead in this game. Probably end up hurting yourself if you tried, actually. Being shunned alone severely limits your access to the resources you need to get many of these distinctions. And being a tamer in the MMJ got me somewhere around 250 zed kills in 15 days (most of them after day 10'ish), by being helpful in keeping zones cleared for camping, and I didn't exactly get the optimal paths with the most kills.

NyxOwl
Thanks to everyone for all of the responses and feedback!

To address a couple of the questions and concerns:

I don't think there is a need for a no shun stipulation. The distinctions that I chose seem to be pretty common ones that don't do damage to a town. I specifically did not include distinctions like building a chainsaw, battery launcher or taking drugs since those can be detrimental and use up precious resources.

Fortis

Maybe it would be easier to just count the total number of the 20 that people played with instead of assigning specific targets?

That is a great idea and I almost want to change it to this but I think it would be fun for the players to have 5 specific people that they need to chase in Season 4 to get into towns with to make it more challenging. Hopefully it will be a way to meet new players that way and give a boost to the available messaging and communication systems. I'm still on the fence about this though because maybe someone will attempt to go after all 20 which would be interesting and add an extra competitive element. What does everyone think about this?

Mesikammen

About those distinctions. Do I need exactly 1 Masochism or can I have more? If I'm allowed to get more than one, does it matter if I get 4 or 99 during the season?

For the contest you just need to meet the minimum amount. You are free to get as many distinctions as you can manage in Season 4 but it does not increase your score for the contest. (The only exception is bonus points for being in multiple towns with BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the name).

Quent

If my town's name is SANDS OF LOST BLOOD, do I get triple points?

Lol, yes you will get extra points if you manage to be in a town with 3 of the key words or in multiple towns with any of the key words.

Scoring:

Each task is worth 1 point.

There are 10 tasks you need to complete in Season 4:

1. Be in at least 1 town with BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the town name.

2. Kill at least 100 zombies

3. Find 1 Roleplay Item

4. Build at least 1 Wonder and receive the distinction

5. 1 Masochism Distinction

6. 5 Alcohol Distinctions

7. 3 Daredevil Camper Distinctions

8. Play all 4 professions (residents can still participate but they will have it extra tough begging for those BIA’s).

9. Post 100 messages

10. Play with 5 specific players

You will get 1 point for each task completed. Bonus points can be achieved by being in multiple towns with either BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the town name. You can also receive bonus points by playing with more players off of “The Hunted List” than the 5 you are assigned. You must play with the 5 players you are assigned at some point within Season 4 to get the initial 1 point for the task.

Using tamle as an example and based on his soul, at the end of Season 4 he would need:

1734 zombies killed (he currently has 1634)
5 RP distinctions (currently 4)
1 Wonder distinction (currently 0)
8 Masochism Distinctions (currently 7)
24 Alcohol Distinctions (currently 19)
25 Daredevil Camper Distincitons (currently 22)
1 Guardian Distinction (currently 0)
47 Scout Distinctions (currently 46)
35 Tamer Distinctions (currently 34)
33 Scavenger Distinctions(currently 32)
2649 Messages (currently 2549)

We would then check his town history to see how many towns he was able to be in that had Blood, Sand or Lost in the title and to see if he was able to play with his 5 assigned players and any other additional players off of "The Hunted List" during Season 4

Thanks again to all of the volunteers and participants in the contest.

Happy Hunting!

Season 4 Scavenger Hunt Official Rules!

What you need to achieve:

1. Be in at least 1 town with BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the town name.

2. Kill at least 100 zombies

3. Find 1 Roleplay Item

4. Build at least 1 Wonder and receive the distinction

5. 1 Masochism Distinction

6. 5 Alcohol Distinctions

7. 3 Daredevil Camper Distinctions

8. Play all 4 professions **an additional profession may be required if a new one is announced for Season 4**

9. Post 100 messages

10. Play with 5 specific players


Scoring:

Each task is worth 1 point. There are 10 tasks you need to complete in Season 4:

You will get 1 point for each of the above 10 tasks completed.

**Bonus points can be achieved by:

Playing in multiple towns with either BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the town name. (1 point for each additional town)

Playing with more players off of “The Hunted List” than the 5 you are assigned. You must play with the 5 players you are assigned at some point within Season 4 to get the initial 1 point for the task. (1 point for each additional player off of “The Hunted List” as long as you have also played with your 5).

Playing in 5 towns that last 10 days or more. (5 points for completing this bonus task). You will only get the 5 points if you played in at least 5 towns that lasted 10 days or more. If you only played in 4 towns that lasted 10 days or more than you get no bonus points

How it will work:

I will take a screenshot of all of the participant’s Soul on the 1st Day of Season 4. (If you are still in a carry over town from Season 3 then your screenshot will be postponed until you are no longer in a town or your Soul shows you are in the 1st town in Season 4).

Screenshots of the Soul Pages will be posted in a contest thread at die2nite.net.

Contest will last all of Season 4. Another screenshot of your Soul will be taken on the last day of Season 4 to tally the results and determine a winner.

***The winner will receive 30 free hero days AND 30 free hero days for ANY player they choose.

The winner will also receive a community distinction. (Thank you to Epoq and The Crow)***

In the event of any ties than a tie breaker contest will be announced.

If you have any questions or to receive updates from me please use the Oval Office mail.

Good Luck and Happy Hunting!!!

---NyxOwl

You will only get the 5 points if you played in at least 5 towns that lasted 10 days or more and you had to have survived at least 10 of those days. If you only played in 4 towns that lasted 10 days or more than you get no bonus points

It's not a requirement it's a bonus...

Scoring:

Each task is worth 1 point. There are 10 tasks you need to complete in Season 4:

You will get 1 point for each of the above 10 tasks completed.

**Bonus points can be achieved by**

Playing in multiple towns with either BLOOD, SAND or LOST in the town name. (1 point for each additional town)

Playing with more players off of “The Hunted List” than the 5 you are assigned. You must play with the 5 players you are assigned at some point within Season 4 to get the initial 1 point for the task. (1 point for each additional player off of “The Hunted List” as long as you have also played with your 5).

Playing in 5 towns that last 10 days or more. (5 points for completing this bonus task). You will only get the 5 points if you played in at least 5 towns that lasted 10 days or more and you had to have survived at least 10 of those days. If you only played in 4 towns that lasted 10 days or more than you get no bonus points

TOTAL SCORE:



Also any notes that you put in your individual towns will be helpful in calculating your score.

Hope you all had fun hunting!

Cheers!
---Nyx
